oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ROLE OF VERTICAL PRESSURE GRADIENT IN WAVE BOUNDARY LAYERS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jensen, Karsten Lindeg√•rd
Sumer, B. Mutlu
Vittori, Giovanna
Blondeaux, Paolo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave boundary layers
turbulence
vertical pressure gradient
DNS
transition to turbulence
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The pressure field in an oscillatory boundary layer is obtained by means of direct numerical simulations (DNS). The vertical pressure gradient is treated as any other turbulence quantity and its statistical properties are calculated from the DNS data. Moreover, a criterion involving the vertical pressure gradient is used to detect spots. The large fluctuations of the vertical pressure gradient, which take place in the turbulent flow, have significant implications for sediment transport.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 34 (2014): Proceedings of 34th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Seoul, Korea, 2014; waves.47
